task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 65°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the top of the building to estimate its height, so I will tilt my view upwards.
I still cannot see the top of the building, so I need to tilt my view further upwards to see the roofline.
I still cannot see the top of the building, so I need to tilt my view further upwards to see the roofline.
My previous attempt to look further up did not register; I will try again to tilt my view upwards to see the top of the building.
Since I cannot tilt my head further up to see the roof, I will move backwards to get a better vantage point of the entire building.
I have moved further away from the building, but now I am facing the wrong direction; I need to turn around to face the building again, which was originally at approximately 65 degrees.
I am facing the wrong direction; I need to turn back towards the building, which was originally at approximately 65 degrees.
I am facing away from the target building; I need to turn left to face it at approximately 65 degrees.
I am still not facing the target building, which is at approximately 65 degrees; I need to rotate right to face it.
I am facing away from the target building; I need to turn left to face it at approximately 65 degrees.
I am not facing the target building, which is at approximately 65 degrees; I need to rotate right by 155 degrees to face it.
I am facing away from the target building; I need to turn left to face it at approximately 65 degrees.
I am stuck in a rotation loop; I need to break it by rotating right by 155 degrees to face the target building at 65 degrees and then assess the view.
I am facing away from the target building; I need to turn left to face it at approximately 65 degrees, which is an available preset rotation.
I am stuck in a rotation loop; I will try to break it by rotating right by 155 degrees to face the target building at 65 degrees, and then I will look up to see the full height.
I am facing away from the target building; I need to turn left to face it at 65 degrees, and I will maintain my upward pitch to see the top.

I am stuck in a rotation loop and my heading is being reset; I will try to reorient towards the target building at 65 degrees by rotating right by 155 degrees and then look up to finally see the building's full height.
I am facing away from the target building; I will use the 'Look LEFT' preset to turn directly to the correct heading of 65 degrees while maintaining my upward pitch to see the building.

I am stuck in a rotation loop; I will try moving towards the building's general direction using the available move that is closest to the target heading of 65 degrees, which is move 1 at a relative heading of 68 degrees.
I have moved to a new position and now need to face the target building, which is at approximately 65 degrees; the 'Look RIGHT' option will turn me to 68 degrees, which is almost perfect.
I am facing 90 degrees East, but the target building is at approximately 65 degrees, so I need to turn left by about 25 degrees to face it directly.
I am facing the wrong direction; I will use the 'Look RIGHT' preset to turn directly to the target heading of 65 degrees.
I am facing 90 degrees, but the target is at 65 degrees, so I will turn left by 25 degrees and simultaneously tilt my view up by 30 degrees to finally see the entire building.
I am facing the wrong direction; I will use the 'Look RIGHT' preset to turn directly to the target heading of 65 degrees while maintaining my upward pitch to see the building.
I can see the building has approximately 6 floors, and assuming a standard commercial floor height of about 4 meters, the total height is around 24 meters.
